article.title: SEDNA Provides Acoustic Interception and Countermeasures
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: SEDNA Digital Solutions, Manassas, Virginia, is being awarded a $14 million modification to a previously awarded contract to exercise an option for the production of AN/WLY-1 acoustic interception and countermeasures systems and technology insertion kits, active intercept and ranging systems, and Archival Media Center systems, including pre-cable kits, maintenance assistance modules, and spares in support of Navy submarine programs. Also included are engineering services and ordering provisions for spare parts. The Naval Sea Systems Command, Washington, D.C., is the contracting activity.
